intro: Cryophytum cleistum, commonly known as the snowflake flower, is a unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family, known for its striking white, bell-shaped blooms. The plant is adapted to cold climates and thrives in alpine environments where temperatures are consistently low. Its flowers are typically closed at night and open during the day, a characteristic that gives it its scientific name "cleistum," meaning "closed." Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
